thread.title: Why dogs are a camper's best friend
thread.title_full: Why dogs are a camper's best friend - Telegraph

author: Natalie Paris
title: Why dogs are a camper's best friend
text: Getting out into the countryside with a dog and letting them bound about freely (provided no sheep are nearby) is one of the best things about owning one. You only need one look at the Instagram feed Camping with Dogs , packed with images of canines wrapped snugly in blankets, peering forlornly through tent zips and just generally having a tongue-lolling good time, to see why dogs are the perfect companion on a trip outdoors. You've still got some time to get a beach camping trip in before the weather turns cold! #campingwithdogs @nancythebeat A photo posted by Camping With Dogs™ (@campingwithdogs) on Sep 15, 2015 at 10:22am PDT The account, which is so popular that it has even spawned its own merchandise of dog-walking accessories, was started in the US by Ryan Carter, from Tennessee, Followers post the latest pictures of their pooch enjoying a hike or a mountain sunset using the hashtag #campingwithdogs. This is what it's all about. Just @jadubya and her favorite four legged best friend. #nationalcampingwithdogsday #campingwithdogs A photo posted by Camping With Dogs™ (@campingwithdogs) on Sep 6, 2015 at 5:48pm PDT A blog connected to the feed lists reasons why dogs make the best camping companions. Your dog is sitting at home wondering when you'll go camping again. So, when are you? #campingwithdogs @thecompasswolf A photo posted by Camping With Dogs™ (@campingwithdogs) on Jul 9, 2015 at 7:39am PDT They include the fact that dogs are good at playing follow the leader. Playing a game: follow the leader. #campingwithdogs @isaaclkoval A photo posted by Camping With Dogs™ (@campingwithdogs) on Jul 20, 2015 at 11:44am PDT • 10 best British hikes That they love napping in tents. To celebrate 40k followers, here's an adorable picture of a puppy sleeping in a tent with mountains in the background. Thank you & you're welcome! #campingwithdogs @misshalimarie A photo posted by Camping With Dogs™ (@campingwithdogs) on Jul 8, 2015 at 5:09am PDT They also love swimming. Holy #*%^! If this doesn't make you want to take your dog and go explore something epic, nothing will! #campingwithdogs @sam__davis in the Alpine Lakes Wilderness, Washington. A photo posted by Camping With Dogs™ (@campingwithdogs) on Aug 24, 2015 at 6:10pm PDT Dogs makes themselves useful by always up in time for sun rise. You might regret waking up at sunrise during the work week but for a view like this, zero regrets. #campingwithdogs @dead_head93 A photo posted by Camping With Dogs™ (@campingwithdogs) on Aug 1, 2015 at 6:07am PDT • 24 of Europe's great walking routes In fact they can be relied upon to get you up every morning. Instagram is about to break... What a way to end National Dog Day! #campingwithdogs #nationaldogday @christianannschaffer A photo posted by Camping With Dogs™ (@campingwithdogs) on Aug 26, 2015 at 8:28pm PDT And they don’t mind muddy trail conditions. Muddy as hell but happy as can be. I'm sure everyone here wants to know, how did you get this dog back in your vehicle?! #campingwithdogs @jmockli A photo posted by Camping With Dogs™ (@campingwithdogs) on May 16, 2015 at 6:24pm PDT Or even snow. Points to the person who knows where this photo is taken! It's on my bucket list for sure. No cheating @cocoprinc3 #campingwithdogs A photo posted by Camping With Dogs™ (@campingwithdogs) on Sep 9, 2015 at 4:31am PDT Who needs blankets? Nap time. #campingwithdogs @loki_the_wolfdog A photo posted by Camping With Dogs™ (@campingwithdogs) on Aug 20, 2015 at 7:30pm PDT • 19 attractions ruined by social media Telegraphtravel Follow @telegraphtravel
